docs.lead_paragraph: Jacob “Jack” Lew, the current White House Chief of Staff, has experience working in both the White House and on Capitol Hill. Here are some of his recent statements on issues he is likely to confront if he is confirmed as secretary of the treasury.

headline.main: For Drug Users, a Swift Response Is the Best Medicine

docs.abstract: An initiative in Vermont has shown that, for drug offenders, quick intervention and treatment, not drawn-out court punishments, work best.
docs.snippet: An initiative in Vermont has shown that, for drug offenders, quick intervention and treatment, not drawn-out court punishments, work best.

docs.abstract: After paying back its bailout, A.I.G. is now considering whether to sue its government rescuers. | Bank of America continues a retreat from the home mortgage market. | Edward S. Lampert, chairman of Sears Holdings, is set to become its chief too. | In relaxing rules for liquidity, bank regulators acknowledged a reality, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes.

docs.lead_paragraph: As our budget braces for Medicare’s tyranny, we just need a good overseer to manage the inevitable military decline.
docs.abstract: David Brooks Op-Ed column warns that Medicare costs will likely lead to squeeze in defense spending; contends that biggest question about Pres Obama's nomination of Chuck Hagel as defense secretary is how Hagel will oversee process of cutting defense spending and manage inevitable military decline.
docs.snippet: As our budget braces for Medicare’s tyranny, we just need a good overseer to manage the inevitable military decline.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: A state law that restricts private health insurance coverage for abortions will go to trial to resolve whether it poses a substantial obstacle to women seeking an abortion, a federal judge ruled.

headline.main: Kansas: Request to Nullify Abortion Law Is Rejected
headline.print_headline: Kansas: Request To Nullify Abortion Law Is Rejected

docs.abstract: Federal Judge Julie A Robinson rules that Kansas state law that restricts private health insurance coverage for abortions will go to trial to resolve whether it poses a substantial obstacle to women seeking to end pregnancies.
docs.snippet: A state law that restricts private health insurance coverage for abortions will go to trial to resolve whether it poses a substantial obstacle to women seeking an abortion, a federal judge ruled.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials could not say for sure whether the low growth reflected the start of a trend or the continuing effects of the recession.

headline.seo: Health Spending Growth Stays Low for 3rd Straight Year
headline.main: Growth of Health Spending Stays Low
headline.print_headline: Growth of Health Spending Stays Low

docs.abstract: Obama administration says that national health spending climbed to $2.7 trillion in 2011, or average of $8,700 for every person in country, but remained stable as share of economy for third consecutive year; officials cannot say for sure whether low growth represents start of trend or reflects continuing effects of recession.
docs.snippet: Officials could not say for sure whether the low growth reflected the start of a trend or the continuing effects of the recession.

docs.lead_paragraph: In any given year, at least eight million vocational students work on assembly lines and workshops, according to estimates from the Ministry of Education.

headline.main: Students by Millions Fill Labor Gap in China

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States spends much more on health care than other advanced nations with public health care systems. By most objective measures, it gets no better results.
